mixed-citation.article-title: Taxonomic study of the genus Microplitis Förster, 1862 (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from Iran

tp:treatment-sec.p: Body length 3.0–4.0 mm; antenna as long as body, F15 length 2.0 × its width ( Fig. 5A ); anteromesoscutum rugose and rugulose; notauli well defined by rugosity; mesoscutellar disc coriaceous to rugulose ( Fig. 5C ); pterostigma length 2.5 × its width; vein R1 shorter than pterostigma (i.e., vein R1 longer than pterostigma half); 1 st discal cell length 1.0–1.1 × its width; vein 1CUb 2.0 × as long as vein 1CUa ( Fig. 5D ); T1 length 1.5–1.6 × its maximum width, T1 more or less broadening posteriorly ( Fig. 5F ). Colour: body black; antenna, tegula and legs reddish yellow or yellow exception of dark brown metacoxa, metatibia and a dark spot at apical metafemur; pterostigma dark brown.

tp:treatment-sec.p: Guilan , Mazandaran and Qazvin Provinces (present study). New record from Iran .
